title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Management Strategies for Anatomy Diagrams

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental biology and general understanding of human anatomy
context.additional_context: Introductory Anatomy Course Linked to Social Sciences, Emphasizing 2D-3D Visualization Training with Digital Devices

learning_goals: Learners can convert 2D anatomy diagrams into 3D structures while minimizing cognitive load.
Learners can apply five CLT (Cognitive Load Theory)-based diagram design principles to real-world cases.
Learners can create anatomy visualization materials that promote learner attention using digital tools.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
